column4: so, mysqladmin won't let me create databases. I've edited /etc/mysql/my.cnf to have a password and the user msql but when I use mysqladmin -u mysql -p creat Mambo and put in the password it doesn't let me create the database

yah, that doesn't work either. doesn't accept my password for some reason. I restarted mysql after changing the my.cnf file too. could it be the debian.cnf file in the mysql dir that is fuxoring it up?
hmm, I would then ask in #mysql
